result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Daniel St John

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] cases #22CF426, #22CF452 called at 1:53pm 
Defendant Jacob Daniel St John appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck (the PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Arguments are given on the State's request for cash bail.
The Court modifies the bond in each file to be a $250 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered. 
Right to counsel is reviewed;  Mr. St. John indicates he is unsure how he will proceed regarding counsel.  The Court refers Mr. St. John to apply at the PD Office. If he is not found eligible, then he may petition for court appointed counsel.   
recess 2:01pm. 
[Post-Hearing: in response to the clerk's inquiry regarding case #22CF426 being at adjourned initial appearance stage, the Court indicates that it continues to toll preliminary hearing time limits in this case.] 

NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status of counsel) in #22CF426 (prelim time limit needs to be addressed in this case only), and Status Conference (status of counsel) in #22CF452--both on November 18th at 1:15pm

[ae] cases 22CF426 and 22CF452 1:53 PM  Defendant Jacob Daniel St John not in court. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court reviews case history.

The Court makes note that Atty Fischer made an appearance in the past and confirms that the Defendant has not retained Atty Fischer
The State requests that a bench warrant be issued.

The Court issues bench warrants in both cases, returnable to any Jefferson County Judge or Magistrate.
The Court finds both signature bonds in default.

recess: 1:57 pm
Returnable to any Jefferson County Judge or Magistrate.
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Original Bond Document rec'd from JESO on 10/12/22

[ma] Case called at 1:31pm 
Defendant Jacob Daniel St John appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription

recess 1:36 pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference on 10/19/22 at 1:15pm (set for prelim)
